titles.title: Energy Efficient Housing Technical Correction Act
Energy Efficient Housing Technical Correction Act
Energy Efficient Housing Technical Correction Act
Energy Efficient Housing Technical Correction Act

To amend section 220 of the National Housing Act to make a technical correction to restore allowable increases in the maximum mortgage limits for FHA-insured mortgages for multifamily housing projects to cover increased costs of installing a solar energy system or residential energy conservation measures.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Mr. Shays moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3724.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.
Senate Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: 4/1/2004--Public Law. Energy Efficient Housing Technical Correction Act - Amends the National Housing Act to make five-family and smaller units eligible for increased mortgage limits to cover the costs of installing solar energy systems or residential energy conservation measures in Federal Housing Administration (FHA)-insured multifamily housing projects.
